comment: 2nd iteration of developing a mild golden ale with some properties of a German Lager. Though the Dry English Ale yeast imparts a certain British quality to the beer, the dryness combined with the melanoidin-rich ancillary malts should yield a slightly hoppy blonde ale that pleases the pale lager drinker.  The first swipe at this (Lucien and Luz Golden Ale) was too dry, too thin, too wheat-rich.  Though drinkable, it did not pass the "Would I order another?" test.
